explanation: Crescent, Gibbous, Quarter, and Full are all recognized phases of the moon. An eclipse, while involving the moon, is an astronomical event rather than a phase of its illuminated appearance.

Cubit, Hand, Pace, and Fathom are historical units of length traditionally based on parts of the human body or human stride. The Meter is a standardized unit from the metric system, not directly derived from the human body.

Heart (heartbreak), Day (daybreak), Ground (groundbreaking), and Fast (breakfast) are all words that commonly precede 'break' to form a well-known compound word or phrase. 'Window' does not form such a common compound.
